Updated by Megan O'Shea to incorporate banner from accession number 2018.098
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Mulvey Family Papers
Mulvey, Kathleen
Mulvey, Elizabeth
AIA.043
3.25 Linear Feet in 1 manuscript box, 1 oversize folder in a shared box, and 1 rolled banner
circa 1929-1936, 1963-1979 1929-1936 This collection consists mainly of materials collected by Kathleen Mulvey documenting her family history. The collection includes family correspondence, panoramas of Irish American social organization functions, a banner celebrating John F. Kennedy's trip to Ireland in 1963, and a scrapbook from Elizabeth Mulvey's first trip to Europe in the late 1920s, which included Ireland, Italy, France, and Switzerland. Elizabeth Mulvey was a teacher and later public school principal in the Bronx. Kathleen Mulvey was the first woman president of the Irish Institute and an active member of the County Carlow Society. Materials are primarily in English, with one banner in Irish.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Gift of Kathleen Mulvey, 1999. The accession number associated with this gift is 1997.032.
An additional accession was donated by Kathleen Mulvey in 2018. The accession number associated with this gift is 2018.098.
Use Restrictions
Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Kathleen Mulvey, the sister-in-law of Elizabeth Mulvey, were transferred to New York University in 1999. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from the Tamiment Library.
Material in the 2018 accretion, which was created in 1963, is in the public domain. Permission to publish or reproduce is not required.
Related Archival Materials
Archives of Irish America County Societies Collection (AIA 003)
Archives of Irish America United Irish Counties Association Collection (AIA 056)
Kathleen Hill Family Collection (AIA 064)
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Mulvey Family Papers; AIA 043; box number; folder number; Archives of Irish America, Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Access Restrictions
Open for research without restrictions.
Scope and Contents
This collection consists of materials collected by Kathleen Mulvey documenting her family history. The collection includes family correspondence, panoramas of Irish American social organization functions, and a scrapbook from Elizabeth Mulvey's first trip to Europe in the late 1920s, which included visits to Ireland, Italy, France, and Switzerland. The collection also contains a banner celebrating John F. Kennedy's visit to Ireland in 1963.
Arrangement
The order in which these materials were sent to the Tamiment Library has been maintained.
Biographical Note
Elizabeth Mulvey was born in the Bronx to a family of Irish immigrants: her father was a carpenter born in the Bronx and her mother was born in Wicklow. Mulvey worked as a teacher and later the principal of a public school in the Bronx.
Kathleen Mulvey was the first woman president of the Irish Institute and an active member of the County Carlow Society.
Processing Information
Material from the 2018 accretion was assessed for conservation treatment and rolled with treated paper to prevent further deterioration.
